newsitem.title: UKRAINE: German banker urges Ukraine to issue foreign bonds.
newsitem.headline: German banker urges Ukraine to issue foreign bonds.

text.p: Ukraine should face no obstacles in issuing foreign currency bonds on foreign markets as long as it sticks to stable policies, a senior German banker said on Wednesday.

"I think Ukraine should go ahead with its plans and issue the bonds, just like Hungary, the Czech Republic and Poland have done," Commerzbank AG board member Klaus-Peter Mueller said during a visit to the Ukraine Interbank Currency Exchange.
"The chief factors necessary to issue such bonds are stable economic and fiscal policies," he said.
Ukraine's central bank chairman Viktor Yushchenko said on Tuesday Ukraine plans to issue foreign bonds next year to raise $250 million towards covering its budget deficit.
Yushchenko said details about times and volumes would be released once the government passes its 1997 budget. --Natalya Zinets, Kiev Newsroom +380 44 229 2264
